response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("age", "medium", "19-year-old males are at a higher risk of recidivism due to impulsivity and lack of life experience, but not as high as younger or older offenders"),
    ("race", "low", "While racial disparities exist in the justice system, race alone is not a strong predictor of individual recidivism risk"),
    ("prior arrests", "low", "One prior arrest without conviction suggests limited criminal history and lower risk"),
    ("physical characteristics", "low", "Height and weight are not significant predictors of recidivism risk"),
    ("marital status", "medium", "Never being married may indicate instability or lack of social support, which can increase recidivism risk"),
    ("education", "medium", "Having a high school diploma is positive, but not being enrolled in college may limit future opportunities and increase risk"),
    ("employment history", "medium", "Holding one job in the past year suggests some stability, but limited work experience may increase risk"),
    ("substance use", "low", "No drug use in the past four years significantly reduces recidivism risk"),
    ("mental health", "high", "Feeling down and unable to be cheered up most of the time in the past month indicates potential mental health issues that can increase recidivism risk"),
    ("family background", "medium", "Living with a biological mother in an urban area at a young age may have provided some stability, but household size and other factors are unknown"),
    ("religious beliefs", "low", "Believing in a higher power can provide support and reduce risk, but this factor is highly individualized and less predictive")
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 67
}

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 19-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 8 inches and weighs 145 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 1 job during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and most of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 3, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
